title: Business Live: US opens steady - BBC News
summary: cma launches probe into online gambling .
eu hopes to capture euro clearing from the uk .

documents.title: 'til next week
text: that 's all from the bbc 's business live page for this week .
join us bright and early again on monday morning when we 're expecting more details on the government 's plans for brexit and mps have scheduled a debate on the grenfell tower disaster .
good night .

documents.title: generation game
text: earlier this week president trump came up with a plan to save mexicans paying the full cost of the border wall which he still fully intends to have built , but which has proved a little tricky to get off the ground .
instead of the mexicans footing the entire bill , they 'll install solar panels along the wall , generating electricity and therefore cash .
well , journalists at bloomberg appear to have had some time on their hands ( quiet summer friday ? )
and have calculated that panels tilted towards the sun along a 3,207km long wall would generate enough electricity for the wall to pay for itself by the year 2168 .
as they said `` that 's more than a few election cycles away '' .

documents.title: markets close
text: that 's it .
the us markets have shut for the week .
as has been the mood for most of the day , all three major indexes remained quiet and obedient .
there were a few wobbles over slightly weaker than expected manufacturing data , but the recovering oil price helped keep things steady .
the dow jones was down 0.96 points or 0.01 % at 21,396.3 .
the s & p 500 was up 3.81 or 0.16 % at 2438.3 .
nasdaq was up 28 or 0.46 % at 6265.2 .

documents.title: a little more would help
text: tesco has said it 's putting up its hourly pay rate for shop staff .
not enough to start planning a blow-out shopping spree , but above the statutory minimum set out by the government .
it amounts to a 10.5 % rise over two years and will put tesco workers on £ 8.42 an hour by november 2018 .
if you 're looking for a checkout job , worth bearing in mind though that the budget supermarkets aldi and lidl are already paying more : £ 8.53 and £ 8.45 respectively .
plus tesco are cutting back the premiums the pay for sunday and bank holiday work .

documents.title: have your say : woman and engineering
text: # inwed17 women make up 8 % of engineers in the uk .
we 're debating the issue .
what questions do you have ?
@ reply
i 'm a engineer and the company i work for has way more than 8 % and new graduates ?
must be nearly 50 % of the intake
my daughter wants to be an f1 engineer .
she 's off to rolls royce for a week on monday but i think it 's a great time to get into it
matt , just get her to go for it so long as she does n't want to head into the oil and gas industry she 'll be fine !
if you 've any advice or good sources for further info will you let me know so i can get her to look it up
mate , f1 is way outside my sphere of understanding as is aeronautics although i can imagine designing the next gen of planes would be
awesome .
i can imagine f1 is ultra competitive .
best bet is just to dive in and see where you end up .
the field is so wide and varied !
say hi to sarah for me !
also , rolls royce are a top quality turbine manufacturer , used all over the world as plane engines and power generators i 've bought some
women are as capable as men in engineering , society should encourage them as early as primary school .
why did the women who did n't become engineers choose not to ?
the answers to that are as diverse as the people .
i have a friend who was forbidden to study physics by her parents because she was a girl and should n't do boystuff .
i have a friend who wanted to be a ballet dancer but did n't because he was told dancing is for girls .
can the world please stop for him ?
exactly .
women have no problem in us saying `` a mother 's instinct '' or `` women are prettier than men '' it 's only the bad stereotypes they hate
men have no problem in us saying they are strong , it 's only the bad stereotypes about aggressiveness or having to pay @ a date that they hate .

documents.title: syngenta 's woes
text: just heading back to the syngenta story , which can trace its roots back to 2010 .
back then the swiss company starting selling a genetically modified corn in the us that was an insect-resistant strain called agrisure viptera .

in 2013 it started selling a second strain called agrisure duracade , but the farmers claim that they were sold the strain without being told that china - a major purchaser of us corn - had not approved it .
syngenta deny the allegations .

but the company will be hearing lots more about china - it is about to be taken over by chemchina , as the country 's leaders look to take greater control over its food supply to feed its ever-growing population .

documents.title: healthcare insurers worried by republican plans
text: pharmaceutical companies may be seeing a boost to their share prices in the last two days , thanks to the unveiling of the republican 's new healthcare plans .
but health insurers are less impressed , with the industry 's largest lobbyist for the sector warning against the plans to scrap obamacare .
kristine grow , spokeswoman at america 's health insurance plans ( ahip ) said : `` we 're worried about the burden it creates for the states . ''
the group represents dozens of insurers who already offer obamacare , but are worried by the consequences if it disappeared .
molina healthcare , which has more than 1m customers in obamacare plans , said the changes will lead healthy people to forgo coverage and lead to premiums rising .

documents.title: syngenta sued for millions over gm seeds
text: a us court has ruled today that swiss seed and pesticide firm syngenta must pay up $ 217.7m to more than 7,000 farmers in kansas over its decision to mass produce a genetically modified strain of corn before china approved importing it .
the farmers said that they suffered tremendous losses after chinese officials starting returning corn shipments in 2013 .
it is the first case of its type , but thousands of other corn producers and traders are also seeking damages over china 's non-approval of syngenta 's corn seeds for importation .
lawyers for the farmers reckon syngenta could end up having to pay out $ 5.77bn in lost revenues , but the company said it will appeal the verdict .

documents.title: us markets update
text: us markets are starting to edge up in afternoon trading .
the nasdaq is on course to record its first weekly gain in three week , thanks to strength in tech firms .
apple , facebook and microsoft all helped push up the index , as investors regained their nerve after fears over the past few weeks that the tech sector is overstretched .
the s & p 500 and dow jones were also both up , with rises helped by the oil price recovery and cautious optimism among big pharma that the new republican healthcare plans will benefit them .
dow jones is up 5.25 points to 21,402.54
nasdaq is up 29.74 points to 6,266.42
s & p 500 is up 5.35 points to 2,439.85

documents.title: bed bath & beyond : shares start to sink
text: turning to the us , and bed bath & beyond has seen its share price hit a nine year low today .
shares are down $ 4.12 , or 12.2 % , to $ 29.62 after the retailer revealed a weak set of results , we were well below what the market had been expecting .
the company said revenues in the first quarter remained flat at $ 2.74bn , short of an expected $ 50m boost , and earnings also under performed .
bosses blamed softness '' in in-store sales ( they did n't get enough shoppers through the doors ) and higher shipping costs , due to extra promotions .

documents.title: brexit : big winners
text: the best performing stocks this year have been materials companies , including miners who report in dollars and have benefitted from the weak pound , while the worst performers are telecoms and utilities , which tend to be solely focused on the uk .
however , the really big winners have been the british government debt with yields ( or the interest we pay to our creditors ) dropping by a quarter over the past year .
by comparison , german and u.s. equivalents have risen .
`` gilts will outperform as growth will ultimately disappoint and increase the risk of a harder brexit outcome , '' morgan stanley market strategist andrew sheets to reuters .

documents.title: brexit : the stock market a year on
text: one year on from the brexit vote , how has the stock market done ?
the main ftse 100 index has risen impressively by 17 % over the 12 months since britain voted to leave the european union .
however , this has been driven almost exclusively by sterling 's fall against the dollar .
if you were to look at share price performance from a dollar viewpoint , they 've actually underperformed every developed index in the world .

documents.title: corbyn : teens should get £ 10 hourly wage
text: following on from tesco raising its wages for shop floor workers , jeremy corbyn has weighed into the low pay debate .
the labour leader suggests his party 's £ 10-an-hour living wage pledge should extend to 16-year-olds .

documents.title: bank of england cleared in sfo probe
text: as the city heads home for the weekend , there will probably be some mighty sighs of relief at the bank of england .
earlier this afternoon , the bank was told by the serious fraud office that police have closed a probe into whether the boe broke the law during the financial crisis .
after two years , the sfo said there 's `` no evidence of criminality '' in the unprecedented actions the bank took during the height of the financial crisis .
they were looking to see whether the bank gave help to certain institutions to assist them in bidding for newly issued bank bonds .

documents.title: uk 's brexit offer 'below expectations '
text: uk 's brexit offer 'below expectations '

documents.title: ftse closes
text: that 's it for the week in london .
the ftse 100 index has closed for the day .
the ftse 100 closed down 15.16 points at 7,424.13 .
in a pretty lacklustre day , investors seemed content with shares bobbing along gently , with no real movement .
it will be welcome news to some , as the sinking oil prices of recent days have hit markets hard .

documents.title: mike ashley sells his rangers fc stake
text: mike ashley , the owner of sports direct , has sold his entire stake in rangers football club .
the billionaire businessman offloaded the 9 % to a consortium of supporter groups and a hong kong based investor .
sport has all the details , and brings to an end one of the uglier business battles of recent times .
many supporters were angry with subsequent deals set up between rangers and mr ashley 's sports direct after the businessman bought his stake .

documents.title: how would you describe trump 's management style ?
text: if readers think theresa may is getting a hard time from business leaders in the uk , spare a thought for president donald trump
a new survey for us network cnbc of chief financial officers across america asking what word best describes the president 's management style has been revealed .
it 's not pretty .
we asked cfos to describe trump 's management style , and it 's not pretty :

you guys are the same as the rest of msm
yeah what 's the bottom line ?
if you can not answer that for yourself then you really do have absolutely no clue
yeah like cfos will praise competition
competition ? ! ? ! ?
he is freakin potus , he does n't have competition he was supposed to have give up his duties doubtf- untrustworthy .

this is very troubling .
nevertheless , it 's important to keep this in mind .
also , politically he keeps on winning .
he is what the country wants .
corporations are 100 % out of touch with the working man .

lol funny how the losers always talk about the popular vote .

sometimes , what the cfo has to say is n't pretty , but it 's often true ( that 's a big part of their job , internal reporting and analysis ) .

documents.title: tesco pay rise analysis
text: sticking with the pay rise to £ 8.42 an hour by november 2018 at tesco for a moment .
the generosity may not be quite what it seems .
tesco ( and everyone else ) must increase its minimum pay to £ 9 an hour by 2020 - because it will be the law ( the national living wage rises to £ 9 an hour by then ) .
what is laudable is , the supermarket appears to be starting the process earlier and quicker than rivals .
but , by comparison , aldi already pay staff at least £ 8.53 per hour , or £ 9.75 per hour for those in london .

documents.title: tesco pay boost for shop staff
text: tesco has announced a 10.5 % payrise for its store staff this afternoon .
it means hourly rates for staff will go from £ 7.62 to £ 8.42 by november 2018 .

the company claim `` these increases , alongside tesco 's benefits package which includes colleague bonus plan and pension , will take the average store colleague to an equivalent hourly rate of £ 9.52 by november 2018 '' .
( although , we ca n't think of too many workers that think of their equivalent hourly rate including pension contributions ) .

documents.title: oil in context - it 's still not great
text: oil might be stabilising , but connor campbell , financial analyst at spreadex , reminds everyone to just think how far oil has fallen in recent months .
he says : `` the black stuff 's gains have n't inspired a more robust rebound from either of the oil giants [ shell and bp ] or the ftse , however , as the commodity is still in serious trouble .
`` at the start of the week brent crude was trading above $ 47 per barrel - but go back two months and it was grazing $ 55 per barrel .
`` even if it has found a bottom there is little reason for investors to pour back into the oil sector . ''

documents.title: currency update
text: to put the impact of the pmi data on the dollar into context :
the euro immediately rose 0.3 % to $ 1.1186 and the dollar fell 0.1 % against the yen , making it worth 111.13 yen

documents.title: us manufacturing stalls
text: an update on the state of us manufacturing has dented the dollar against some foreign currencies this afternoon .
the widely-followed markit pmi numbers show that output in the us was slightly down in june compared with may , although they were still looking good .
output was measured at 53.0 , compared with 53.6 in may - a three month low .
the services sector was at 53.0 , compared with 53.6 in may - also a three month low .
manufacturing pmi is at 52.1 versus 52.7 in may - a nine month low .
and manufacturing outpute is at 52.9 versus 53.7 in may - also a nine month low .
anything below 50 is seen as a sign of contraction .
earlier today the eurozone pmis also came out and were ahead of expectations .

chris williamson , chief business economist at ihs markit said : `` the average expansion seen in the second quarter is down on that seen in the first three months of the year , indicating a slowing in the underlying pace of economic growth . ''

he added : `` there are signs , however , that growth could up again : new orders [ spending ] showed the largest monthly rise since january , business optimism about the year ahead perked up and hiring remained encouragingly resilient . ''
the numbers are a good indicator , because they generally track a country 's gdp , as the chart below shows .

documents.title: wall street opens
text: ding ding !
wall street is open for business .
the quietness of yesterday seems to be repeating itself , with all three major indexes opening relatively flat .
investors will be waiting to see what happens with the price of oil - which fell earlier in the week , dragging down share prices with it .
but two days of relative stability in the price of oil has meant no sudden jerks in the markets .
a stress test by the federal reserve on the us banking sector also calmed things , as the largest institutions were deemed able to withstand a severe recession .
the dow jones is down 27.84 points ( or 0.13 % ) at 21,369.45
s & p 500 is up 0.35 points ( or 0.01 % ) at 2,434.85
and nasdaq is down 2.92 points ( or 0.05 % ) at 6,233.77

documents.title: lloyds ' internet banking down
text: lloyds bank has apologised for problems with its internet banking service .
customers say they are unable to log onto the website , and the bank has confirmed it is `` experiencing difficulties '' .
it assured customers that it was `` working to fix '' the problem , and that the app remained available .
faults in online banking are relatively common , but fridays tend to be busy for transactions as people prepare for the weekend .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: toshiba gets relegated
text: going back to toshiba for a moment , things are going from bad to worse for the japanese electronics and nuclear business .
bosses sought , and got , an extension on revealing their results after auditors failed to sign off their accounts , and they also said today that losses to come in at 995bn yen 950bn yen .

but the massive losses have also come with another price - prestige - as the tokyo stock exchange demoted toshiba from the top tier of the exchange ( think of a british company getting demoted from the ftse 100 to the ftse 250 )
to make matters worse , if toshiba do n't get its accounts signed off by 10th august , it could be delisted entirely .

documents.title: ecb bids for more euro clearing oversight
text: the european central bank has put forward a proposal to boost its oversight over euro clearing .
the legal amendment would give it a `` significantly enhanced '' role in regulating the lucrative market .
london currently processes most of the trade in this financial sector , providing thousands of jobs .
the ecb 's proposal comes shortly after the european commission published a draft law to give it the power to move euro clearing business out of london .
clearing is where a third party organisation acts as a middleman for buyers and sellers of financial contracts tied to the underlying value of a share , index , currency or bond .
the ecb said the amendment would give it `` clear legal competence '' in the area of central clearing , which is currently dominated by london firms .

documents.title: economists say eurozone growth steady
text: growth in the eurozone is on `` cruising speed not acceleration '' according to economists at morgan stanley .
a survey of purchasing managers ' plans in the eurozone indicated steady growth if not as much as expected .
bert colijn , ing senior economist for the euro zone , said : `` businesses experienced the strongest growth quarter in six years .
but risks remain .
in other data , italy , the currency bloc 's third largest economy , reported a sharp fall in industrial sales and orders in april .

documents.title: blackberry 's first quarter sales fall
text: sales at blackberry fell to $ 235m in the three months to may , down from $ 400m compared to the first quarter of 2016 .
the company , which once produced the handsets of the same name but now focuses on software and services , reported falling revenue across all geographical regions .
however , blackberry returned to profit during the first quarter with net income of $ 671m compared to a $ 670m loss a year ago .

documents.title: brexit creator says uk can change mind
text: brexit creator says uk can change mind

documents.title: itv leads the ftse 100
text: the ftse 100 is trading down 25.80 points at 7,413.49 .
itv remains the top gainer - its share price is up 2.6 % at 181p - after the broker morgan stanley upgraded its view of the broadcaster 's stock for the first time in more than a year .
the ftse 250 has reversed earlier falls and is now up 16.49 points at 19,674.91 .
the pound is 0.35 % up on the dollar at $ 1.2728 .
here is how sterling has fared over the last month , including the general election .

documents.title: watch : how velcro became a million dollar idea
text: the bbc 's aaron heslehurst tells how velcro was invented after a walk in a wood

documents.title: parting shot from bank of england 's kristin forbesbbc economics correspondent andrew verity tweets
text: outgoing bank of england mpc member kristin forbes says there 's no longer justification for emergency interest rates : we need 'lift-off ' :
alleluia .
honestly , wrote and suggested that , nimbler approach to using interest rates , decade ago !
would have some justification had last month not shown consumer spending tanking .
increase interest rates will surely only worsen that ?

documents.title: eu prepares to move agencies from london
text: eu prepares to move agencies from london
author: Laurence Peter
BBC News

documents.title: government orders investigation into hotpoint fridge
text: the government has ordered an immediate examination by technical experts of a hotpoint ff175bp fridge freezer which has been determined by the metropolitan police service to be the initial source of the grenfell tower fire .
at least seventy-nine people are feared dead after the blaze .

in a statement , the government said the product , which was manufactured between 2006 and 2009 , has not been subject to product recalls and testing will establish whether any further action is required .

the department for business , energy and industrial strategy said consumers who believe they may own a hotpoint fridge freezer model number ff175bp ( white ) or ff175bg ( grey ) should call whirlpool corporation 's freephone hotline on 0800 316 3826 or visit www.hotpointservice.co.uk/fridgefreezer to register their details for further updates .
it said : `` at this stage there is no specific reason for consumers to switch off their fridge freezer pending further investigation . ''
business secretary greg clark said : the safety of consumers is paramount .
the device is being subject to immediate and rigorous testing to establish the cause of the fire .
i have made clear to the company that i will expect them to replace any item without delay if it is established that there is a risk in using them . ''
read the full statement here .

documents.title: hotpoint issues statement on grenfell tower
text: hotpoint has issued a statement after the metropolitan police identified a ff175bp fridge freezer as the initial source of the grenfell tower fire .
it said : words can not express our sorrow at this terrible tragedy .
we offer our most profound condolences to the victims , those who have lost loved-ones , homes , and possessions , and to their friends and families .
`` our thoughts and prayers are with all those involved , including the emergency services who risked their lives to extinguish the blaze and rescue those in the building . ''
it says : `` we are working with the authorities to obtain access to the appliance so that we can assist with the ongoing investigations .
`` under these circumstances , we are unable to speculate on further details at this time .
we are addressing this as a matter of utmost urgency and assisting the authorities in any way we can .
we will provide additional updates as our investigations progress . ''
hotpoint advises that consumers who believe they may have a hotpoint fridge freezer model number ff175bp or ff175bg should call its freephone hotline on 0800 316 3826 .
or they can visit hotpointservice.co.uk/fridgefreezer .

documents.title: oil prices rise but stay below $ 50
text: the price of brent crude rose on friday but remains well below $ 50 a barrel .
it increased by 0.4 % to $ 45.42 a barrel on friday morning .
west texas intermediate also rose by 0.4 % to $ 42.92 a barrel .
frank schallenberger , head of commodity research at lbbw , expects prices to bottom out between $ 40-45 per barrel before returning to $ 50 until the end of the year .
commenting on current price , he said : `` there is selective perception in the market at the moment .
bearish factors like higher output in libya or nigeria result in lower oil prices but bullish factors , like the really high opec commitment , are ignored . ''

documents.title: hotpoint named as grenfell tower fire fridge supplier
text: # hotpoint have just been named by @ twitterid as the supplier of the fridge/freezer at the centre of the grenfell fire .
wow !
that 's some statement to make .
are they 100 % sure it was faulty ?
how old it was ?
etc etc .
is that the police 's role nowadays ?
details just being released by hotpoint .
it is the police job to establish source of the fire .
agreed .
just not sure it 's police 's role at this stage to say who the manufacturer is ?
such a clamour for an immediate blame-game these days

documents.title: virus helps drivers dodge fines
text: hackers behind the infamous wannacry virus have inadvertently helped lead-footed australian drivers avoid costly speeding fines .
some 55 traffic cameras , most in inner-city melbourne , were infected by the ransomware .
a maintenance worker unknowingly uploaded the malware to the camera network using a usb stick on 6 june .
victorian police have cancelled 590 speeding and red-light fines despite the belief they were correctly issued .
read the full story here .

documents.title: soft and hard brexit 'not understood '
text: soft and hard brexit 'not understood '

documents.title: listen : bring your dog to work
text: does having a dog in the office improve morale ?
how could it not
it 's # bringyourdogtoworkday .
can having dogs in the office improve employee morale ?
learn more : # archive
depends on the dog
i would call out

documents.title: vw to buy back diesel cars
text: vw has agreed to buy back some diesel cars equipped with illicit emissions control software in germany .
the company decided not to appeal court rulings backing claimant 's calls for compensation .
vw said its decision to forego an appeal was an exception and stemmed from the low value of the vehicles in question .
it said it had no bearing on ongoing cases .
despite vw 's admission of wrongdoing in the us , the company says it has not broken the law in europe and sees no reason to compensate customers .
it has said it will fix all affected vehicles by the autumn .

documents.title: pharma sector preparing for brexit
text: far from being in `` denial '' about brexit , as a kpmg report suggests , the association representing britain 's drugs companies says it is quite the reverse .

dr virginia acha , the executive director of research at the association of the british pharmaceutical industry said : `` i 've just come from a major regulatory conference in the us where every global pharma company was present .
`` none of them were in denial , in fact most of them have made quite a lot of planning and have considered how to react in the next couple of months .
`` it is important for government to give us as much clarity as possible . ''

documents.title: merkel : uk brexit offer 'a good start '
text: merkel : uk brexit offer 'a good start '

documents.title: brexit : test your knowledge of the uk economy
text: it is one year since britain voted to leave the eu and the office of national statistics has come up with a quiz to test people 's knowledge on how britain 's economy has fared during those 12 months .
how well will you do ?
what 's changed in the uk economy in the year since the # brexit vote ?

documents.title: a delicious deal for uber
text: it has been quite a week for uber .

the taxi-sharing firm 's chief executive and co-founder travis kalanick stepped down as chief executive ; one of the investors who ousted him left the board and then more than 1,000 employees signed a petition to get mr kalanick reinstated in a new role .
one could only end it with a flourish and has uber come up with a corker .
it is teaming up with mcdonald 's to launch `` mcdelivery '' - which means people can have their orders delivered to them courtesy of ubereats between 7am to 2am .
it will apply to 22 locations across london , as well as 10 others in nottingham and leeds .
deliveries can be made to addresses within 1.5 miles of a mcdonald 's .
it could be rolled out further if successful .
and it probably will be .

documents.title: watch : becoming mario
text: new york-based abhishek singh has made playing super mario an altogether more immersive experience courtesy of augmented reality .

documents.title: demand for workers up in france
text: french businesses took on workers at the fastest rate in nearly 10 years , according to new data .

ihs markit said that although french business activity slowed to a reading of 55.3 in june compared to 56.9 in the previous month , firms expanded their payrolls at the quickest pace since august 2008 .
ihs markit chief economist chris williamson , said : `` the strength of job creation very much suggests that companies are in expansion mode and moving away from focusing on cost efficiencies . ''
he said he expected france - europe 's second largest economy - to expand by 1.5 % for this year , which would be the strongest growth since 2011 .

documents.title: juncker gives short shrift to may 's proposalbbc political editor laura kuenssberg tweets
text: president of the european commission jean-claude juncker is unimpressed with uk prime minister theresa may 's opening gambit on eu citizens 's rights .
juncker on citizen 's proposals - 'it 's a first step but that step is not sufficient '
we need a step from him then
juncker is right .
eu asked clarification on the extent to which rights of eu citizens are also passed on to descendants .
kids get deported ?
in what circumstances would a child be deported ?
may should extend the pledge to cover children , like the eu have suggested in their proposal and have asked for from the uk in reciprocity .
the uk prop covers children in residence
how about if your son is in boarding school in germany ?
or your partner and daughter are still back in paris ?
if you want them to be resident in the uk you have roughly 4 years to bring them over .
this is how most country 's operate .
at least we agree the next step is not with the eu , but we are still waiting for the actual proposal from the uk .
i do n't think uk quite gets it .
uk voted to leave .
pm issued art 50 .
eu does n't have to negotiate sweet fa .
think asking for pay rise .
and we do n't need to buy german cars or french wine either .
true john you could make your own in the nissan vw and bmw factories .
there would have been no vw had it not been for the uk after 45 !
there would have been no ford but for usa .
not sure how relevant 80 years ago is .
best try reading history books then !
the post war agreement actually had vw plant for destruction .
it was uk officer who saved it .
not sure relevance to today .
no us money no eu
perhaps he might consider the views of member states ' leaders on the matter before putting forward his own jaundiced view of eu or nothing .
uh , you realise that the member states are the one that approved the commission 's negotiating mandate ?
both in euco and council of eu .
uh , yes .
but look at the response of merkel compared to junker .
she said it was a 'good start ' .
until the council of the eu change it , the commission 's negotiation mandate wo n't change .
if it 's to be a true negotiation the council will need to amend some aspects at some stage , otherwise it is n't a negotiation .

documents.title: blue skies return for allied irish bank
text: allied irish bank returned to the stock market on friday after the government sold 25 % of the lender .
shares in the bank were priced at a mid-range of 4.40 euros each and the float raised 3bn euros for ireland 's taxpayers .

allied irish bank was among the lenders that the irish state had to rescue during the financial crisis , which cost 64bn euros in bailouts and forced it to seek support from the european union and the international monetary fund .

minister for finance paschal donohoe said : the successful completion today of aib 's initial public offering represents a significant milestone in the government 's long-held policy to dispose of our banking investments , returning them to the private sector over time . ''

documents.title: french first quarter gdp revised up
text: the french economy has performed better than expected .
gdp grew by 0.5 % in the first quarter from the previous three months , according to the insee statistics agency , up from a previous estimate 0.4 % .

documents.title: shares fall but the pound rises
text: itv is leading the ftse 100 risers on friday as the wider market trades lower .
the broadcaster 's share price is up 2 % at 180.5p .
however , the ftse 100 is down 23.70 points at 7,415.59 .
the pharmaceuticals , mining , drinks and sub-prime lending sectors were represented among the morning 's largest fallers , led by mediclinic international whose share price fell by 1.48 % to 763p .
on the currency market , the pound rose 0.37 % against the dollar to $ 1.2730 .

documents.title: toshiba revises up annual loss
text: toshiba says that last year 's loss was even worse than it initially thought .
for the year which ended in march it now says it loast 995.2bn yen ( $ 8.95bn ) , in febraury it said the loss was 950bn yen .
the widening losses reflect legal bills and further liabilities at its bankrupt us nuclear unit .
toshinba plans to file its annual earnings on 10 august after receiving an extension to a deadline from japanese regulators .

documents.title: drugs agency relocation 'needs quick decision '
text: the agency that is responsible for the evaluation , supervision and safety monitoring of medicines across the eu - the european medicines agency - is in london at the moment , but it 's going to move somewhere else after brexit .

elizabeth kuiper , director of of european affairs at the european federation of pharmaceutical industries , told the bbc 's today programme that the decision about the relocation of the agency will be postponed from october to november this year .

`` you can imagine that for our industry , and also for patients , it 's really key that we have a very quick decision about the relocation of the agency , so in that respect , we really call on the heads of state not postpone the decision any longer but really take a very quick decision . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ftse indexes open lower
text: traders sent the ftse 100 down as the market opened on friday .
the blue chip index shed 22.13 points to 7,417.16 .
the ftse 250 is off 23.33 points at 19,635.09 .

documents.title: britain is stuck with hinkley point
text: a national audit office report into the new nuclear power plant at hinkley point in somerset calls the project `` risky and expensive '' .
but it looks like the uk is stuck with it .
tom greatrex , chief executive of the nuclear industry association , told the bbc 's today programme : `` this project is now under construction .

it started last year , there are thousands of people on that site at hinkley in somerset at the moment building that power station , pouring concrete and getting that power station up and running . ''
he said : `` it is really important that we get new capacity built because we 've got so much that is going offline in a relatively short space of time .
`` we 've left it a long time and actually saying we should reassess and start again - we have n't got the luxury of time to be able to do that . ''

documents.title: health and safety is 'good for business '
text: uk safety experts are calling on the government to strengthen health and safety laws , following the grenfell tower fire .
more than 70 organisations and safety experts have written an open letter to the prime minister saying deregulation of health and safety legislation has to stop .

lawrence waterman , one of the signatories of the letter , told the bbc 's today programme : `` over the past few years the health and safety executive has had its budget cut which means far fewer inspections .
`` overall there 's this atmosphere that health and safety is about red tape .
we never talk about white tape or gold tape .
good health and safety enables good business . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: cma to investigate online gambling industry
text: the competition and markets authority has announced that it is taking enforcement action against several online gambling firms over concerns that people are being treated unfairly .
the cma has singled out areas such as `` sign-up promotions '' as a potential problem .
they are designed to attract players onto casino-like gaming websites by offering bonus cash when they put in their own money .

but the cma said it is `` concerned that people often do n't get the deal they are expecting as the promotions come with an array of terms and conditions that are often confusing and unclear and , in some cases , may be unfair '' .

it added : `` customers might have to play hundreds of times before they are allowed to withdraw any money , so they do n't have the choice to quit while they 're ahead and walk away with their winnings when they want to . ''

documents.title: breakingecb makes a play for euro clearing business
text: the european central bank is proposing a statute change to become the euro clearing regulator .
the majority of euro clearing currently takes place using uk-based houses .

documents.title: business 'in denial ' about brexit
text: it is now a year since britain voted for brexit but businesses are doing little to prepare for it , according to a report from accountancy firm kpmg .
partner tim sarson said across the board all sectors seem to have `` hardly scratched the surface '' and that business were 'in denial ' .
`` i think a lot hope it will be kicked into the long grass , with a long transition period that never ends . ''
he said theresa may 's lack of a majority and the uncertain outcome of the election allowed some of them to put off thinking about it for a little bit longer .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: toshiba delays filing full-year results
text: toshiba has asked regulators for an extension for filing its annual financial results after its auditor failed to sign off on the figures .

the japanese conglomerate had hoped to submit its results by 30 june but has asked for an extension until 10 august , due in part because of an accounting investigation of its now bankrupt westinghouse nuclear unit .

documents.title: virgin media customers urged to change their password
text: virgin media urges password change over hacking risk
this is hilarious when you are limited to 10 chars and no special chars allowed .
who ca n't hack in to @ twitterid their security is a joke
it 's always a good move to change the default password on anything .
just like it 's always a good move to do frequent backups of vital data .
if people just had a bit of common sense they would change default passwords .
however we live in a dumb 'd down world & people ca n't be arsed
amazing !
this is highly unlikely to occur .
the attacker needs to be within wifi range and know that you have n't changed the default wifi pw
@ twitterid any comment/advice for your customers ?
did n't this happen a couple of weeks ago ?

documents.title: premier inn urgently reviews cladding
text: concerns about the use of inappropriate cladding on tall buildings have now spread beyond the housing sector .

newsnight has learned the hotel chain premier inn has three buildings in maidenhead , brentford and tottenham whose cladding does not appear to meet building rules - although less flammable than that used at grenfell tower .

the company , which is owned by whitbread , said an independent expert has assured them that the hotels were safe to stay open given their `` robust '' safety measures including fire detectors and smoke alarms in every room .
the company says it will address any concerns with developers .

documents.title: opec 'is a busted flush '
text: the oil price is heading for its worst start to the year since 1997 despite opec and non-opec nations agreeing to extend a production cut .
so why is oil at $ 45 a barrel ?
`` shale oil , '' says expert james spencer from portland fuel price protection .
after a glut of supplies sent the price to $ 25 in 2016 , many us shale oil producers went bust or cut production .

mr spencer tells wake up to money that since prices have recovered from that low point `` the shale guys have come back to the market '' and he reckons that opec `` is a bit of a busted flush '' because it has showed that it can not control the oil price .

documents.title: eu citizen welcomes may 's brexit proposal
text: what do europeans living in the uk think about theresa may 's proposal to allow around three million eu citizens living in britain to remain after brexit ?

wake up to money spoke to damien , a polish chef consultant living in peterborough who voted for brexit because of how eu regulations impact on the kitchen - he cites the importance of using locally sourced ingredients .
he said the prime minister 's proposal is `` one of the positive things that will happen soon '' which `` will give us full rights '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to business live .
prime minister theresa may will embark on the final day of her visit to brussels on friday after detailing a plan to allow european citizens to stay in the uk after brexit .
the oil price remains in focus .
it has crept back up to $ 45 a barrel but following a 20 % fall since january , it is on course for the worst start to the year since 1997 .
stay with us throughout the day for all the breaking news in business and economics .
